items.sentence: I wish that you wouldn't always yell at Tom.
I was happy to hear that Tom wasn't injured.
I think that you should be careful with Tom.
I think that Tom might have some good ideas.
I promised Tom that I'd go fishing with him.
I promised Tom that I'd go bowling with him.
I hope that we don't have problems with Tom.
I have a few more questions I'd like to ask.
I don't think very many people will do that.
If you want someone to help you, go ask Tom.
We stayed in an inexpensive hotel in Boston.
Tom said it didn't look like Mary was tired.
When Tom and I got home, we were very tired.
What Tom and I are doing is perfectly legal.
Tom has a phone, but he doesn't use it much.
Tom had a doctor's appointment this morning.
Tom drowned in his neighbor's swimming pool.
Tom doesn't seem to be as motivated as Mary.
Tom doesn't seem to be as ambitious as Mary.
Tom doesn't always pay attention to details.
Tom didn't seem to be as hungry as Mary was.
Tom could be Canadian, but I don't think so.
Tom isn't in the kitchen or the living room.
Tom isn't a difficult child to take care of.
I brush my teeth at least three times a day.
Tom is usually on time for his appointments.
Tom is going to let Mary borrow his bicycle.
Tom is definitely the right man for the job.
Tom is always early and Mary is always late.
Tom has recently been transferred to Boston.
Tom has finally finished doing his homework.
Tom has already phoned me three times today.
Tom has already drunk three glasses of wine.
I used to be a better chess player than Tom.
If it's too good to be true, it probably is.
She was strong enough to run a 10-mile race.
She was a rather prim and proper young lady.
Tom got to Mary's house a little after 2:30.
Tom doesn't really need to know what we did.
Tom slept while I finished eating breakfast.
I took more medicine than I was supposed to.
What surprised me most was how much Tom ate.
Tom thinks he's acting in our best interest.
I'll pass by the post office on my way home.
I put the money that I owe you on the table.
Tom drank absinthe, and Mary drank red wine.
Tom gave us all a bite of his chocolate bar.
I thought you'd finished doing that already.
Where's the proof that he committed a crime?
It's easier not to start than it is to quit.
